title: Prohibition: untargeted scraping to build facial recognition databases

article_refs.quote: the placing on the market, the putting into service for this specific purpose, or the use of AI systems that create or expand facial recognition databases through the untargeted scraping of facial images from the internet or CCTV footage;

legal_consequence.verbatim: The placing on the market, the putting into service for this specific purpose, or the use of AI systems that create or expand facial recognition databases through the untargeted scraping of facial images from the internet or CCTV footage is prohibited.
legal_consequence.notes: Applies to AI systems that create or expand FR databases via untargeted facial image scraping from internet or CCTV.

items.label: Recital (43) â€” context
items.text: Recital (43): Such practices add to the feeling of mass surveillance and can lead to gross violations of fundamental rights, including privacy.

items.label: Penalty and enforcement (Article 99)
items.text: Prohibited practice. Operators shall not place on the market, put into service for this specific purpose, or use the AI system as described. Non-compliance may trigger cessation/withdrawal measures under national procedures. Administrative fines up to EUR 35,000,000 or 7% of worldwide turnover (whichever is higher), with SME caps; case-by-case factors and due process apply.

facts.summary: Provider deploys a crawler to automatically harvest facial images at scale from social media and public CCTV streams to populate and enlarge a searchable facial recognition database offered to clients.
Research project with consented participants; no bulk scraping from internet or CCTV; closed dataset; not used to create/expand a public FR database.
On-device face unlock; no scraping and no creation/expansion of an FR database.
